issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5. Description
In windows, if a ListItem has a button in it, clicking the button does not fire ListView's itemClick event.

h5. Steps to reproduce: 
Run the attached Alloy project - TestListViewButton
Click on rows in ListView outside button. Log statment will be printed as '[INFO]  List View Item Click:::  itemContainer'
Click on buttons in ListView rows. No log statement will be printed.
fields.summary: Windows: Click on button in ListItem does not fire itemClick event
fields.environment:
Operating System
  Name                        = Microsoft Windows 10 Home
  Version                     = 10.0.15063
  Architecture                = 64bit
  # CPUs                      = 4
  Memory                      = 15.9GB

Node.js
  Node.js Version             = 6.10.3
  npm Version                 = 5.3.0

Titanium CLI
  CLI Version                 = 5.0.14
  node-appc Version           = 0.2.41

Titanium SDKs
  6.1.2.GA

comments.body: I have tested this on iOS with Titanium SDK 6.1.2.GA, but this doesn't work even on iOS too. So I would resolve this as "Won't fix" or "Invalid" because we always treat iOS as "reference platform".  [~vvazquezmontero] Could you confirm this with customer?
Thanks Kota I will share with the customer
Thank you [~kiguchi] I will share with the customer
Resolving this as "Won't Fix" because this doesn't work even on iOS and we have a workaround for this. Feel free to create new feature request if customer thinks this as important feature.
Closing old "Won't fix" tickets. If you disagree, please reopen.
